name: Mini Veggie Pizzas
description: Fun and easy mini pizzas made with whole wheat English muffins, topped with veggies and cheese.
ingredients: 4 whole wheat English muffins, split in half
instructions: Place the muffin halves on a baking sheet and spread a thin layer of tomato sauce on each.
Top with mozzarella cheese, diced bell peppers, sliced olives, and cherry tomatoes.
Sprinkle with dried oregano and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
cookingNote: For a healthier option, use low-fat cheese and extra veggies.
author: Chef Lucy

name: Banana Oatmeal Bites
description: Sweet and nutritious oatmeal bites made with bananas, oats, and honey, perfect for kids' snacks.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350째F (175째C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a bowl, combine the mashed bananas, oats, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla extract.
Stir in the mini chocolate chips if using.
Scoop tablespoon-sized portions of the mixture and form into small balls.
Place on the baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
cookingNote: For an extra treat, dip the bites in peanut butter or yogurt.
author: Chef Emma

name: Apple Sandwiches with Peanut Butter
description: Healthy and fun apple slices with peanut butter and granola, perfect for kids.
ingredients: 2 apples, cored and sliced into rings
instructions: Core and slice the apples into rings.
Spread peanut butter on one side of each apple slice.
Sprinkle granola on top of the peanut butter and top with another apple slice.
Drizzle with honey if desired and serve.
cookingNote: For added flavor, try using almond butter instead of peanut butter.
author: Chef Lily

name: Veggie Sticks with Hummus
description: A nutritious and crunchy snack made with fresh veggie sticks and a side of creamy hummus.
ingredients: 2 carrots, peeled and sliced into sticks
1/2 red bell pepper, sliced into sticks
instructions: Slice the cucumber, carrots, and bell pepper into sticks.
Serve with a side of hummus for dipping.
cookingNote: You can substitute hummus with guacamole for variety.
author: Chef Mia

name: Cheese and Crackers
description: A simple yet delightful snack with cheese and whole grain crackers, great for kids.
instructions: Place a slice of cheese on each cracker.
cookingNote: Add some apple slices for a sweet contrast with the cheese.
author: Chef Oliver
